vision_mission.slu: We envision Saint Louis University as an excellent missionary and transformative educational institution zealous in developing locally responsive, globally competitive, and empowered human resources who are creative, competent, socially involved, and imbued with Christian spirit.
vision_mission.school: The School of Engineering and Architecture (SEA) envisions herself as an exemplary educational institution for engineering and architecture dedicated to elevating instruction, research, and extension to a higher level of competence and creativity committed to shaping the socio-technical environment founded on Christian values.

program_educational_objectives: Demonstrate technical competence in problem analysis and systems design considering technical, societal, environmental, and ethical dimensions.
Apply talents and potential in professional practice guided by Christian values of honesty, service, dedication, and moral responsibility.
Pursue advanced education, research, development, and creative efforts in science and technology.
Participate actively in addressing social, technical, and business challenges vital to national development.
program_learning_outcomes: Apply knowledge of mathematics, science, and engineering fundamentals to solve complex engineering problems.
Conduct investigations using research-based knowledge and methods, analyze data, and synthesize valid conclusions.
Design systems, components, or processes addressing public health, safety, cultural, societal, and environmental needs.
Function effectively as an individual and as a team member or leader in diverse and multidisciplinary settings.
Compose substantiated conclusions through analysis using first principles and research.
Apply ethical principles and commit to professional responsibilities.
Communicate effectively with the engineering community and society through reports, presentations, and documentation.
Evaluate the sustainability and societal impact of engineering solutions.
Engage in independent and life-long learning amidst technological change.
Assess societal, legal, and cultural responsibilities relevant to engineering practice.
Use modern tools, including modeling and simulation, with awareness of limitations.
Apply management principles and economic reasoning to team leadership and project management.
Demonstrate competence in at least one geodetic engineering focus area to solve real-world problems.
Practice Christian values as Louisians in service of the CICM mission.

undergraduate_freshman: Must pass the SLU College Entrance Examination (SLU-CEE).
SLU-CEE is conducted on weekends from mid-October to mid-December.
transfer_students: Accepted in all courses except Bachelor in Medical Laboratory Science.
Must pass the Qualifying Examination (QE), followed by a Personality Test and Interview.
Foreign transfers must pass the English Proficiency Test (EPT).
graduate_program: Must have completed the prerequisite degree.
Master’s applicants must hold a bachelor’s degree.
Doctorate applicants must have a relevant master’s degree.
foreign_students: Should apply at least 6 months before the term begins.
Must be in Baguio at least 4 weeks before classes to complete the EPT, SLU-CEE/QE/GPEE, and Personality Test.
Must undergo preadmission at the Student Affairs Office.
Must secure a valid Student Visa.

fees_ay_2022_2023.note: Fees are subject to change without prior notice
